results.title: The Beauty of effort = La Beaute de l'effort
results.creator_credit: Marc de Gastyne, Raymond Hakim, Robert Hakim and Natfilm
results.brief_description: Modern athletes movements are demonstrated in slow motion to illustrate the beauty of athletic sports, their special forms, their grace and their power. Tours French training centres for physical education instructors at Antibes, Joinville, Bordeaux and Poitiers. French language - no subtitles.

results.title: The Beautiful troublemaker = La Belle noiseuse
results.creator_credit: Jacques Rivette, Martine Marignac, George Reinhart Productions and Pierre Grise Productions
results.brief_description: A film dramatically uncovering the process of creating art, in particular nude portrait painting. Set in rural France, Nicholas and girlfriend Marianne (Emmanuelle Beart) are affected by a visit to a local artist’s stone mansion. The artist is a former famous painter Frenhofer (Michel Piccoli) who lives with his wife (Jane Birkin). Frenhofer wants Marianne to model for him and Nicholas, also an artist, pushes her to do it. A long film in two parts, director Jacques Rivette shows the development and challenges to the artist and his muse. Tension and soul searching evolves as an outcome of the creative process and painting technique is shown for each work (based on paintings by Bernard Dufour). Based on a book by Honore De Balzac. Winner of the Grand Prix at the 1991 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: The Beautiful state of mind: Massachusetts
results.brief_description: Massachusetts’ forests, rivers, roads, villages in all four of the year’s seasons. A simulated colonial village, snowmobiling, bobsledding and other sequences covering the Boston symphony, a country furniture auction, canoeing, sporting events and nightlife are all highlighted in this travel documentary.

results.title: The Beats go on: percussion from Pleistocene to Paradiddle
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the existence of percussion instruments throughout man’s history, examining both development and playing techniques. Considers the types of idiophones which make a sound when they are hit, shaken or struck. Features drummer, Shelly Manne. Suitable for secondary years 7-12.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 8. July 1968 to the End
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Picture Music International, EMI/Parlophone and Apple
results.brief_description: Things are passing strange and fairly fast but the music holds out until the end. This final tape evades nothing and reveals the rents and splits that ended the 1960s. Episode 8: Ringo quits (slow Helter Skelter in background), making of the White Album, closing the Apple Boutique, intro sequence to Hey Jude, origins of Hey Jude, Get Back sessions, Paul and George argue on film, Magic Alex, Recording at Savile, discussions about the rooftop concert, Paul marries Linda Eastman, drug raids, John marries Yoko, breaking up, Allan Klein, Abbey Road film from last photo session, talking about Free As A Bird, studio out-takes. Other songs include Revolution promo film, Hey Jude promo film, The Long and Winding Road, Let It Be out-take, Don’t Let Me Down, Get Back, Let It Be, Something promo film, Free As A Bird.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 7. June 1967 to July 1968
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Picture Music International, EMI/Parlophone and Apple
results.brief_description: It is the Summer of Love, and those whom Timothy Leary has called the “avatars” sing All You Need is Love on black and white television on the first world satellite television program. Episode 5 starts with the leadup to All You Need Is Love, George visits Haight-Ashbury, meditation and the maharishi, Brian Epstein dies, Brian Epstein montage to You’ve Got Hide Your Love Away out-take, making of Magical Mystery Tour [308785], opening the Apple Boutique, the trip to India, the Beatles with ukulele, James Taylor, The Iveys (Badfinger), Mary Hopkins, film from the White Album sessions, Yellow Submarine, the movie and Beatles cameo, Yoko Ono. Other songs include All You Need Is Love broadcast, colourised, Fool On The Hill, Your Mother Should Know, I Am The Walrus, Ed Sullivan intro to Hello Goodbye promo film, Across The Universe out-take montage, Lady Madonna promo film, All Together Now, While My Guitar Gently Weeps demo.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 6. July 1966 to June 1967
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Picture Music International, EMI/Parlophone and Apple
results.brief_description: This episode contains so many astonishing advances, reverses, setbacks and recoveries that in fiction, many of them would be edited out. Starts with the infamous Philippines trip, John’s Jesus statement and the Beatles backlash, last concert, Candlestick Park, Backwards in time concert footage montage, time off after touring, John in How I Won The War, Paul and excerpts from The Family Way, interviews outside Abbey Road during Sgt. Pepper sessions, the making of Strawberry Fields Forever - the promo film and mellotron intro by Paul, making of Penny Lane, making the Sgt. Pepper album, Sgt. Pepper album cover animation from 1987 special, making of A Day In The Life with film from orchestra party, reaction to Sgt. Pepper, Jimi Hendrix covers Sgt. Pepper, Paul admits LSD use. Other songs included: Paul does Eleanor Rigby, cut to recorded version and back, For No One, Penny Lane promo film, A Day In The Life, Take 1, Strawberry Fields Forever Take 1.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 5. August 1965 to July 1966
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Picture Music International, EMI/Parlophone and Apple
results.brief_description: Included here is a wealth of unseen and forgotten footage. The four are never more musical, confident, fluent or assured but hints of a bad day in Manila bring us up short and it seems that things are about to change Episode 5 starts with the Shea Stadium intro by Ed Sullivan, Meeting Elvis, more tour craziness, musicianship deteriorates, new musical directions, Rubber Soul, Revolver, excerpts from the film Yellow Submarine, home movie footage, Munich, Introduction to LSD, the Beatles talk about promo films, 1966 World Tour, live performances at Budokan. Songs included: Twist And Shout, I Feel Fine, Baby’s In Black, I’m Down, Norwegian Wood take 1, Tomorrow Never Knows take 1, Nowhere Man, Day Tripper promo video, We Can Work It Out promo video, Paperback Writer promo, Rain promo, Rock And Roll Music, Paperback Writer, Yesterday, And Your Bird Can Sing out-take.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 4. August 1964 to August 1965
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Picture Music International, EMI/Parlophone and Apple
results.brief_description: The Beatles are now number one all over the world. Success, well earned is assumed a natural state. They are as happy and polite as can be but their music tells a different story: Help!, I’m a loser, Yesterday, I’m really down. Episode 3 starts with the 1964 American tour, live at the Hollywood Bowl, the Beatles meet Bob Dylan, they discover herbal jazz cigarettes, suffer tour craziness, the making of I Feel Fine film clip, filming of Help! origins of Yesterday, George’s songwriting, the Beatles receive M.B.E.s, live at Shea Stadium with pre-show excerpts. Songs included: I Feel Fine, All My Loving, Kansas City/Hey, Hey, I’m A Loser (John plays harmonica a la Dylan), Everybody’s Trying To Be My Baby, You’re Gonna Lose That Girl, You’ve Got Hide Your Love Away, Yesterday, I’m Down, She’s A Woman, Act Naturally, Ticket To Ride and If You’ve Got Trouble.

results.title: The Beatles Anthology 3. February 1964 to July 1964
results.creator_credit: Geoff Wonfor, Chipps Chipperfield, Picture Music International, EMI/Parlophone and Apple
results.brief_description: This was still a time of wonderment on both sides of the equation; the world couldn’t believe this magnificent creation and neither could they believe the world. Wherever they went now, first America, then Europe, the Far-East and Australia, they brought Beatlemania with them. Episode 3 starts with their arrival in New York and a press conference, limo and hotel film footage and Murray The K.the Beatles first appearance on the Ed Sullivan show, a train trip to Washington, live at the Olympia Stadium, with some live colour film footage, their vacation in Miami, packing and returning to England, making A Hard Day’s Night [508638], excerpts from A.H.D.N, In His Own Write by John Lennon. a world tour, Jimmy Nichol substitutes for Ringo, Ringo rejoins in Australia and A Hard Days Night premiers in Liverpool. Songs Included: All My Loving, She Loves You, I Saw Her Standing There, Please Please Me, I’ll Follow The Sun, This Boy, If I Fell, Can’t Buy Me Love, Long Tall Sally, You Can’t Do That, and out-takes from I’ll Be Back.
